summary:
After having taught my mother tongue German for many years at secondary schools in different countries I have discovered another fulfilling task for me to do where I dived into passionately:

In Company Trainings German and Translation German-Dutch and Dutch-German! 

My goal is not only to prepare employees to communicate more efficiently and profoundly in the use of the German language but also to raise their awareness of the cultural differences between the two countries when using the German language in a business environment. 

As a native German living in the Netherlands I can pinpoint mistakes often made and help in understanding the German way of thinking and the German way of doing business. Employees will know how to avoid these mistakes based on cultural misunderstanding/differences. 

With humour and enthusiasm I will coach businessmen and -women doing business in a Germany related environment in how to write professional emails, have phone conversations, give PowerPoint presentations, read and understand specific work related texts and communicate in the German language. 

I will help you face the challenge of the German culture and language by offering custom-made language programmes tailored towards your specific work area and wishes. 

The German Dutch Chamber of Commerce states: 

Germany is by far the most important trade partner of the Netherlands. Satisfactory trade relations are of great significance for the constant expansion of the Dutch and German economy. 
Mastering the German language is one of the basic conditions in order to acquire contracts with German companies. Having a profound/proficient knowledge of the German language plays a mayor role in export and import of service and goods between the Netherlands and Germany. 

(http://www.dnhk.org/ueber-uns/standpunkte/standpunkt-7-grenzueberschreitender-handel/)
